class_g_03_home_01: Put away your phones. It is time to begin class.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_02: In my last class, I taught about HP restoration.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_03:
However, after class, I was asked by several of
you about [clr:6]Power Points[clr:0], commonly known as [clr:6]PP[clr:0].[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_04:
When a Pokémon loses all of its HP, it faints and
can no longer battle![npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_05:
What, then, happens to a Pokémon when it loses
all of its PP?[npcn:29]
class_g_03_select_02: It won’t listen to its Trainer
class_g_03_select_03: All of its stats get lowered

class_g_03_home_answer_02:
That would certainly be a dangerous situation,
but that is not the correct answer.\c
Whether a Pokémon listens to its Trainer depends
on the number of Gym Badges the Trainer has.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_answer_03:
That would certainly be a dangerous situation,
but that is not the correct answer.\c
That is not the sort of power we are talking
about when we talk of Power Points.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_06:
When a Pokémon runs out of PP, it can no longer
use its moves.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_07:
However, each move has its own store of PP, so
you can mitigate PP loss by using a variety of\r
moves rather than just one move repeatedly.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_08:
If a Pokémon loses all PP for all of its moves, it
will only be able to use Struggle—an action that\r
also damages the Pokémon that uses it.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_09:
In order to avoid this predicament, PP can be
restored at Pokémon Centers along with HP.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_10:
Items such as Ethers and Max Ethers can also be
used to restore PP. Be careful not to confuse\r
Potions with Ethers in the heat of battle![npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_11:
However, Ethers are not sold at shops, so you
should use them judiciously if you find them.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_12:
The stronger the move, the lower its maximum PP.\c
Do not waste uses of these moves unless you wish
to quickly run out of PP. It is important to find\r
balance in a Pokémon’s set of moves.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_13:
As you can see, HP isn’t the only thing you must
keep an eye on while adventuring with Pokémon.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_14:
I hope that you will all take care to ensure that
your partner Pokémon can perform at their best\r
as you each engage in the Treasure Hunt.[npcn:29]
class_g_03_home_15:
Our time together has come to an end for today.
Our next meeting will be an examination day.\r
Be sure to review well in preparation.[npcn:29]
